posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked:
Hello, my team is using a swerve drive this year for the first time during a season. We started working on it last year during off season and the entire thing worked fine, but since the new WPILib came out we found we couldn’t import our old swerve drive code into the new version due to the vendordeps libraries. Anyway we decided to get some new code from the YAGSL and got a new set of .json files just to be sure.

When we ran the code on the swerve drive all the modules faced the correct directions but it had a weird issue with the drive motor inputs where the robot didn’t follow the joystick inputs it would just move and have random times when it just goes to full speed and then jumps back down.

Any ideas would be great also the code is just from the example YAGSL code unmodified, here is our github page .

link_counts.title: GitHub - BroncBotz3481/YAGSL-Example: Yet Another General Swerve Library Example Project

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Canbus should be left blank in your module json files, unless you have a Canivore, when it would be the String name of the Canivore. The only number should be the id

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: Alright should this fix the issue, do I just set it to null?

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: But each module moves to face the correct direction

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: Nope didn’t seem to fix the problem at all, it’s like it jitters its kind of like its disabling it by itself

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: Don’t see the module json changes on Github Newer version of YASL FRC2025/vendordeps/yagsl.json at main · BroncBotz3481/FRC2025 · GitHub Are all your SparkMax up to date in firmware. When disabled do this test https://docs.yagsl.com/configuring-yagsl/when-to-invert Check gyro Gyroscope | YAGSL The default drive mode is field oriented Reduce the angle p gain

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: Ill try all of that stuff, but what I’m saying is that all the modules face the correct way but it’s to do with the driving
This bug has been fixed and the patch will be released later tonight. It was due to a faulty kA calculation in the drive motor feedforward

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: Alright, Thanks you for letting me know ill have a go testing it tommorow

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked: So will I have to get a new version of the example code or are there supposed to be updates with the vendor libraries ?

posts.name: Joshua Scott
posts.cooked:
Hey, the code was fixed by updating to the new version of their base code and updated all of the libraries.

Although in constants any in other places where you set max speed it now works in feet instead of meters as it used too. If you want to work in meters I just used the “Units.metersToFeet” function.
Huh?! That doesnt make any sense. I think your max speed was just low

posts.name: Shaun
posts.cooked:
In the YAGSL example code src/main/java/Constants.java:

Blockquote public static final double MAX_SPEED  = Units.feetToMeters(14.5);

Thus MAX_SPEED = 4.4196 m/s.

Our testing produces a slow driving Robot, perhaps limited to MAX_SPEED = 4.4196 ft/s. Should the line of code above be?

Blockquote public static final double MAX_SPEED  = 14.5; // ft/s

Edited: for clarity/grammatical error.

Absolutely, except your units are wrong! I just use feet/s bc i have more yard sticks than meter sticks. It converts feet to meters and uses that to calculate your ChassisSpeeds used to control your robot.

The units of the MAX Speed is always meters/second and the conversion does limit you to 4m/s by default AND I EXPECT TEAMS TO CHANGE IT!

This is not the same as saying the units is ft/s. The units are m/s
